content.text:
# GeeksPhone Revolution

| image = Wzwz_revolution_-5.jpg
| manufacturer = GeeksPhone
| available = January 2014
| screen = 4.7" LCD
| camera = 8 MP
| front_camera  = 1.3 MP
| operatingsystem = Android 4.2.2 “Jellybean”, CyanogenMod 11 (based on Android 4.4 “KitKat”; Firefox OS 1.3 / 2.0
| input =
*Capacitive multi-touch IPS display
| cpu =
*1.6 GHz dual-core Intel Atom Z2560
| memory = 1 GB LPDDR2
| storage = 4  GB EMMC
| memory_card = microSD, up to 32 GB
| networks =
*GSM / GPRS Class 12 / EDGE Class 12 850 / 900 / 1800 / 1900
*HSPA/UMTS 850 / 900 / 1900 / 2100
*HSDPA, up to 21 Mbps
*HSUPA, up to 5.76 Mbps
| battery =
* 2000 mAh removable battery
* micro-USB charging
| connectivity =
* WLAN IEEE 802.11 b/g/n
* Bluetooth 3.0
* micro-USB 2.0
* GPS
* AGPS
* SIM
| form =
| size =
* Width:
* Height:
* Thickness:
| weight =
| releasedate =
}}
The GeeksPhone Revolution is a smartphone released by GeeksPhone in January 2014. It uses the x86 architecture and PCI bus instead of the ARM architecture. It is capable of running either Android or Firefox OS, but lacks a dual boot facility.
See also
*Comparison of Firefox OS devices
References
